THE SAN ANTONIO SPURS will not let Kawhi Leonard join the Los Angeles Lakers because it could then lead to LeBron James also heading to their west coast rivals.

“Not only do the Spurs not want to give Kawhi what he wants and send him to a conference rival, they don’t want to strengthen a conference rival in any way,” Broussard said on The Herd.

“So they don’t want LeBron going there either.”

He added: “There is no reason for the Spurs to make a trade in the next two weeks.

LeBron James' Decision Not Dependent On Whether Lakers Acquire Kawhi Leonard

A source close to LeBron James denied a report from Stephen A. Smith that he reached out to Kevin Durant to see if he would be interested in joining him on the Los Angeles Lakers.

The source added that James' decision is not "sealed (or doomed) by whether or not" the Lakers trade for Kawhi Leonard.

Reporting on Wednesday indicated that there was pressure being applied on the Lakers to acquire Leonard to help their odds in signing James.
